other_tests.findings: Opening pressure of 11 cm H2O; two white blood cells; CSF cultures negative.
Temporal arteritis confirmed via biopsy, showing disruption of the internal elastic lamina with a central luminal thrombus.
Increased degeneration and lipid storage in type I fibers; fiber size variability increased.
Generalized 2- to 3-Hz rhythmic spike-and-wave discharges; resolved after treatment.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Resolution of generalized rhythmic activity, replaced by diffuse low-amplitude fast activity secondary to medication.
